body:
There's a post claiming that Ruqqus has some kind of quarantine, fortunately the explanation is rather more mundane. Note that I have no affiliation with Ruqqus other than being a poster, and browsing the source code out of interest. 

This is a quick look in the source code that's responsible for filtering out offensive content, and shows how transparent the process actually is. 

1. When generating the user feed, a property of the currently active user is checked to determine whether or not they want to see offensive content. The default is not, and looks to be done so as to filter it for non-authenticated users. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/front.py#L71)

2. This flag can be changed via the user settings form, it's a simple checkbox. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/settings.py#L38)

3. New submissions are categorised whether they're offensive by being checked against a list of slurs; if they find a match then they're flagged as offensive. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/posts.py#L372)

4. The list of slurs is surprisingly short - and is mainly pertaining to racism. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/master/ruqqus/assets/slurs.txt) 

5. The slurs file is also accessible directly from the user profile page; it's not hidden or guarded in anyway. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/42ceb7f320deec304816a5729bdeb4456fbeb006/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html)

Whether you agree with it or not, its hardly quarantining. Everyone still has a voice and the ability to post their content, just everyone has an option to avoid it too. If I recall correctly, this is actually an implementation of something that was discussed in this guild.
body_html:
There's a post claiming that Ruqqus has some kind of quarantine, fortunately the explanation is rather more mundane. Note that I have no affiliation with Ruqqus other than being a poster, and browsing the source code out of interest.

This is a quick look in the source code that's responsible for filtering out offensive content, and shows how transparent the process actually is.

  1. When generating the user feed, a property of the currently active user is checked to determine whether or not they want to see offensive content. The default is not, and looks to be done so as to filter it for non-authenticated users. source

  2. This flag can be changed via the user settings form, it's a simple checkbox. source

  3. New submissions are categorised whether they're offensive by being checked against a list of slurs; if they find a match then they're flagged as offensive. source

  4. The list of slurs is surprisingly short - and is mainly pertaining to racism. source

  5. The slurs file is also accessible directly from the user profile page; it's not hidden or guarded in anyway. source

Whether you agree with it or not, its hardly quarantining. Everyone still has a voice and the ability to post their content, just everyone has an option to avoid it too. If I recall correctly, this is actually an implementation of something that was discussed in this guild.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: Toggle the offensive word filter in your settings. If there's any posts or comments with those slurs in them they will then be hidden.
